summary: Fort Worth is the fifth largest city in Texas.
full_text:
Wharton County is a county located in the U.S. state of Texas. As of the 2010 census, its population was 41,280. Its county seat is Wharton. The county was named for brothers William Harris Wharton and John Austin Wharton.
The El Campo, TX Micropolitan Statistical Area includes all of Wharton County.
^ "State & County QuickFacts". United States Census Bureau. Retrieved December 29, 2013. 
^ "Find a County". National Association of Counties. Retrieved 2011-06-07.
title: Wharton County, Texas
